definitions.title: n. m.
definitions.body: :Je 9, 17 eyelid (NH id.; from fluttering ?);—only du. cstr. (v. infr.) and sf. [[עַפְעַפַּי]] Job 16:16, Ps 132:4, [[עַפְעַפֶּיְ]] Pr 4:25, Pr 6:4, etc.;—eyelids, usu. nearly = eyes (6 t. ‖[[עֵינַיִם]]), as weeping, [[עַפְעַפֵּינוּ]] Je 9:17; closed in sleep Ps 132:4, Pr 6:4, cf. of [[חַלְמָוֶת]] Job 16:16; looking Pr 4:25 cf. Ps 11:4 (of ´[[י]], testing men); used seductively by wanton women Pr 6:25; raised, in arrogance (‘ superciliousness ’ Pr 30:13; fig. [[עַפְעַפֵּי־שָָׁחַר]] Job 3:9 eyelids of dawn, break of dawn, Job 41:10 (sim.).
